item.description: Scripting with Bash Bash Scripting Basics A shell script is simply a file that holds a certain set of commands to be run within your terminal and executed by Bash Commonly ending with the file extenstion .sh (although not necessary) shebang - informs OS what shell to use when executing the script. The shebang points to the absolute path of the shell (#!/bin/bash) Executing a Script File Executing or running a script file can be done in multiple ways
